SMAN 1 Tenggarong Juara 1 LCC Empat Pilar Tingkat Nasional
03 Nov 2019, 14:34 by Alfi Kholisdinuka
Jakarta - Grand Final Lomba Cerdas Cermat (LCC) Empat Pilar yang berlangsung di Gedung DPR/MPR Nusantara IV Kompleks Senayan, Jakarta berlangsung seru dan meriah. Sejumlah pelajar yang terdiri berbagai daerah saling beradu pikiran dan gagasannya dalam menjawab pertanyaan seputar wawasan nusantara.
Acara yang dilaksanakan dalam merayakan sumpah pemuda ini tak lupa menghadirkan sejumlah isu yang menarik sehingga mengasah kemampuan nalar kritis peserta. Di antaranya, amandemen negara, soal jabatan Presiden dan Wakil Presiden maksimal tujuh tahun untuk satu periode dan penggunaan pengantar bahasa asing di sekolah-sekolah di Indonesia.
Dalam pantauan detikcom, penonton yang merupakan para peserta pendukung Lomba Cerdas Cermat Empat Pilar 2019 ini terlihat begitu antusias dan berdecak kagum dengan gaya argumen dalam menjawab setiap pertanyaan yang diberikan oleh pembawa acara. Sesekali mereka memberi tepuk tangan apabila jawabannya benar.
Hal itu juga diakui oleh Anggota MPR Fraksi Golkar Idris Laena yang menyatakan lomba cerdas cermat ini menjadi salah satu sarana bagi pelajar untuk mengenal tentang bagaimana empat pilar MPR itu teraktualisasikan dengan baik. Pandangan peserta LCC diakuinya ini sangat bagus.
"Kami bangga karena ternyata anak-anak kita luar biasa dari SMA negeri yang ikut dari semua provinsi luar biasa mereka dapat memahami dan membacakan, memberikan pandangan-pandangan mereka tentang kegiatan 4 pilar MPR Republik Indonesia ini luar biasa," ujar Idris saat ditemui diakhir acara, di Kompleks Senayan, Jakarta, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Idris yang juga merupakan juri di LCC Empat Pilar ini mengungkapkan pemahaman para peserta ini harus menjadi cermin dalam meningkatkan kecintaan masyarkat terhadap negara. Sebab ia menilai akhir-akhir ini banyak sekali masalah kebangsaan akibat ketidakpahaman tentang nilai-nilai negara.
"Saya kira ini penting sekali untuk menghadapi banyak problem kebangsaan kita terutama soal pancasila. Sehingga dapat menghindari istilah radikalisme ataupun perbedaan-perbedaan tentang ideologi dan lainnya," jelas Idris.
"Karenanya kegiatan ini akan memberikan pesan kepada seluruh rakyat Indonesia. Ayo kita semua rakyat Indonesia pahamin itu, kita tingkatkan nilai-nilai kebangsaan itu supaya menjadi pemahaman kita dan saya kira harus menjadi pemahaman seluruh rakyat Indonesia," tandasnya.
Sebagai informasi, gelar juara pada final Lomba Cerdas Cermat ini diraih oleh SMAN 1 Tenggarong Kalimantan Timur, posisi kedua diraih oleh SMAN 2 Sampit Kalimantan Tengah dan juara ketiga SMAN 1 Brebes Jawa Tengah. Juara pertama berhak menerima uang pembinaan sebesar Rp50 juta, juara kedua Rp40 juta, dan juara ketiga Rp30 juta.
Sementara itu Ketua Tim SMAN 1 Brebes M. Raihan Diki Ramadhan mengungkapkan perasaannya atas hasil yang dicapai timnya. Menurutnya, apa yang berhasil dicapai saat ini patut syukuri, sebab semua adalah hasil dari upaya dan kerja keras yang maksimal.
"Persiapan yang kami lakukan untuk tampil berlomba sangat baik. Kami belajar dan berlatih dengan giat baik dengan tim ataupun secara individu, memprediksi potensi-potensi kesalahan dan menggunakan strategi-strategi yang kami rasa efektif," ungkapnya
Persoalan belum bisa mencapai Juara 1 Nasional, tambah Raihan, itu adalah evaluasi bagi tim dan sekolah, agar lebih bersemangat lagi belajar dan berupaya agar bisa meraihnya dikesempatan yang akan datang.
Terkait penyelenggaraan LCC Empat Pilar, Raihan sangat mengapresiasi MPR karena menyediakan wadah kepada generasi muda bangsa dari seluruh wilayah Indonesia untuk lebih memahami Empat Pilar MPR yakni Pancasila, UUD NRI Tahun 1945, NKRI dan Bhinneka Tunggal Ika.
Di kesempatan yang sama, guru pendamping SMAN 1 Brebes M. Anas Rifai mengungkapkan bahwa persiapan-persiapan, teknik, strategi yang dilakukan semua sudah maksimal. Bahkan makin serius lagi ketika tim berhasil mewakili provinsi ke ajang nasional. Semua materi yang diberikan MPR dipelajari secara intens. Bahkan latihan dilakukan secara periodik seminggu sekali.
"Dari mulai tahap seleksi di provinsi, kemudian masuk nasional, lalu berlaga di Grand Final dan meraih Juara III Nasional adalah tak disangka-sangka oleh kami, sebab setelah lima tahun ikut LCC di provinsi, baru tahun ini sekolah kami masuk nasional di Jakarta dan berhasil menempati Juara III Nasional," ungkapnya.

SMAN 1 Tenggarong won 1st place at the LCC Four National Pillars
Nov 3 2019, 14:34 by Alfi Kholisdinuka
Jakarta - Four Pillars of the Smart Pillar (LCC) Grand Final which took place at the DPR / MPR Nusantara IV Building Senayan Complex, Jakarta went on exciting and lively. A number of students from various regions clashed with their ideas and ideas in answering questions about the archipelago's insights.
The event which was held to celebrate the oath of the youth did not forget to present a number of interesting issues, thus honing the participants' critical reasoning abilities. Among them, state amendments, about the position of President and Vice President a maximum of seven years for one period and the use of foreign language instruction in schools in Indonesia.
In the AFP watchlist, the audience, who were participants of the 2019 Four Pillar Quiz Contest, looked very enthusiastic and were amazed by the style of argument in answering every question given by the emcee. Occasionally they give a round of applause when the answer is correct.
It was also acknowledged by MPR Golkar Faction Member Idris Laena who stated that this quiz contest became a means for students to get to know about how the four pillars of the MPR were actualized. The LCC participant's view was very good.
"We are proud because it turns out that our extraordinary children from state high schools who participated from all the extraordinary provinces were able to understand and read, giving their views on the activities of the four pillars of the MPR Republic of Indonesia that were extraordinary," Idris said when met at the end of the event. , in the Senayan Complex, Jakarta, Sunday (3/11/2019).
Idris who is also a jury in the Four Pillars LCC said that the understanding of the participants must be a mirror in increasing the community's love for the country. Because he considers that recently there are a lot of national problems due to a lack of understanding of state values.
"I think it is very important to face many of our national problems, especially about Pancasila. So as to avoid the term radicalism or differences about ideology and others," Idris explained.
"Therefore this activity will give a message to all Indonesian people. Come on, we all understand that the Indonesian people, we will enhance the national values so that it becomes our understanding and I think it must be the understanding of all Indonesian people," he said.
For information, the winner in the final of the Quiz Competition was won by SMAN 1 Tenggarong East Kalimantan, the second position was won by SMAN 2 Sampit Central Kalimantan and the third winner was SMAN 1 Brebes, Central Java. The first winner is entitled to receive coaching money in the amount of IDR 50 million, second prize IDR 40 million, and third prize IDR 30 million.
Meanwhile, Team Leader of SMAN 1 Brebes M. Raihan Diki Ramadhan expressed his feelings for the results achieved by his team. According to him, what has been achieved at this time should be grateful, because everything is the result of maximum effort and hard work.
"The preparation we have done to perform is very good. We study and practice diligently both with teams and individually, predict potential mistakes and use strategies that we feel are effective," he said
The issue has not been able to reach the National Champion 1, added Raihan, it is an evaluation for the team and the school, so that they are more eager to learn and try to be able to achieve it in the future.
Regarding the implementation of the Four Pillars LCC, Raihan greatly appreciated the MPR for providing a forum for the nation's young generation from all regions of Indonesia to better understand the Four Pillars of the MPR namely Pancasila, the 1945 Constitution of the Republic of Indonesia, the Republic of Indonesia and Unity in Diversity.
On the same occasion, the accompanying teacher from SMAN 1 Brebes M. Anas Rifai revealed that the preparations, techniques, and strategies that were carried out were all maximal. Even more serious when the team succeeded in representing the province to the national event. All materials provided by the MPR are intensively studied. Even the exercises are done periodically once a week.
"From the selection stage in the province, then entering nationwide, then competing in the Grand Final and winning the National Champion III was unexpectedly by us, because after five years of joining the LCC in the province, only this year our school entered nationally in Jakarta and succeeded occupy the National Champion III, "he said.
